results.title: White clay and ochre
results.brief_description: Australian aboriginal cave paintings in ochre tell of their tribal life in western New South Wales. Finger, brush and stencil techniques are used to portray hunting kangaroos and emus, corroborees, magic and ritual maps. Special equipment is used by a field party to copy the paintings to scale for detailed scientific record and research. A cave-floor is carefully excavated to find implements used by the cave dwellers, and charcoal samples taken for dating tests. Music from “Namatjira” by Clive Douglas.

results.title: Whistling Smith
results.creator_credit: Marrin Canell, Michael Scott, Barrie Howells and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Sergeant Bernie “Whistling” Smith pounds the beat on Vancouver’s east side - the hang-out of petty criminals, down-and-outs, and a variety of unsavory characters. His policing is unorthodox. To many a drug user, petty thief, or young woman drawn into prostitution, he is more than the iron hand of the law, he is also counsellor and friend. Here is a revealing insight into one side of big-city life and a tough cop with a big heart.

results.title: Where to live
results.creator_credit: Joe Scully, Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows how a voluntary group of people set out to fill, in part, the needs of the aged people in the community. Discusses problems of selecting a suitable location to build a home, raising funds, and designing a home to meet varying needs of the people. Raises psychological problems of rehousing the aged; interviews indicate the anxiety they feel in leaving their own home, and their doubts of surviving on their own.

results.title: Where there's smoke
results.brief_description: A compilation of satirical anti-smoking clips. Animated clips include: Artificial Lung: A youngster is encouraged to smoke because by the time he grows up, portable artificial lungs will probably be available. Cheat: People who are tempted to cheat the government out of taxes are advised to quit smoking. Dynamite: When he cannot find a match, a worker explodes when using a fuse to light his cigarette. Firing Squad: A man facing a firing squad boasts that despite smoking, he anticipates being in good health for the rest of his life. Fringe Benefits: Benefits of smoking include extracting information from spies, damaging furniture and providing work for the medical profession. Funeral: A clever way to kill an enemy is to offer him a cigarette every time you see him. Hero: A man who works and plays hard may be a hero but a smoker is a slave. Lover: By the time a man reaches a woman whose very long cigarette he has lit, she has aged dramatically—”the longer you smoke, the shorter life gets.” Suicide: Smoking is recommended as an efficient way to commit suicide. Volcano: A voice bragging about having always smoked turns out to belong to an erupting volcano. Live-action clips include: Carmen: An opera singer prepares for the starring role in Carmen as she smokes but collapses in a coughing fit when she starts to sing. Coffee House: Exasperated by the number of people smoking around her, a woman in a cafe clears the premises by putting on a gas mask and petting a skunk. Cough Dance: A smoking couple cough as they dance until they can dance no longer. Party: The hostess offers cigarettes to her guests of whom the healthy-looking decline and the haggard-looking accept. Vampire: A vampire collapses after biting a chain smoking woman.

results.title: Where there's a will: dental health
results.creator_credit: Patrick Filmer-Sankey and Gerard Holdsworth Productions
results.brief_description: A live-action story into which the message is women that by caring for their teeth, young people will give themselves something valuable in life. Story of a school film society which tries to win 100 pounds for the best film about teeth. They find out that their original idea would cost too much, but by drawing their own posters they produce an intriguing five-minute film.

results.title: Where the wild things are (K)
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Morton Schindel, Kratky Film and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Presents an animated adaptation of the story of the same title by Maurice Sendak in which a small boy makes a visit to the land of the wild things. Tells how he tames the creatures and returns home. Animation: Bohumil Sejda.

results.title: Where the profits lie
results.creator_credit: John Wiles, Geoff Busby and British Information Services
results.brief_description: Shows profitable egg production, high-lighting the new ideas of economic poultry nutrition and how research has developed a low stress diet, which enables hens to produce more eggs with reduced mortality rate and at a lower cost.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Wiles, Geoff Busby and British Information Services
